channel.title: The only thread to look at for me. connectivity issue
channel.description:
I know I have a few threads here but all of those problems have been dealt with.
My last and final issue is connectivity. I've gotten everything to run and start up t and I am able to connect and log in if the IP's in the gui and client are set to 127.0.0.1. Once I change them to my no-ip, I cannot log in anymore (and therefore neither can anyone else). Here are a few things to note
1) I AM USING A VIRTUAL MACHINE (VMbox - running windows 7. The host computer is a Mac) 2) My firewall on the VM is OFF. 3) I HAVE a no-ip set up and a no-ip.duc (not sure if the info is correct) 4) I have "tried" to portforward (not sure if the info is correct)
This is most certainly a port forwarding issue, I would think... Can I not port forward correctly on a VM?
This is getting very frustrating. I hope someone can help me. Thanks

item.title: The only thread to look at for me. connectivity issue
item.dc:creator: @Flubbypb Flubbypb
item.description:
@Flubbypb wrote:

I know I have a few threads here but all of those problems have been dealt with.

My last and final issue is connectivity. I’ve gotten everything to run and start up t and I am able to connect and log in if the IP’s in the gui and client are set to 127.0.0.1. Once I change them to my no-ip, I cannot log in anymore (and therefore neither can anyone else). Here are a few things to note

  1. I AM USING A VIRTUAL MACHINE (VMbox - running windows 7. The host computer is a Mac)
  2. My firewall on the VM is OFF.
  3. I HAVE a no-ip set up and a no-ip.duc (not sure if the info is correct)
  4. I have “tried” to portforward (not sure if the info is correct)

This is most certainly a port forwarding issue, I would think… Can I not port forward correctly on a VM?

This is getting very frustrating. I hope someone can help me.
Thanks
